content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a potential landlord named Peter Schmidt from Germany.
name: Max Müller

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of this conversation was about the rental price of an apartment in Magdeburg, Germany.
name: Max Müller

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why didn't you agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: I did not agree on a final price because the landlord was unable to lower the price to meet my budget. The landlord's final offer was 580 Euro per month, which was higher than my offer of 550 Euro per month.
name: Max Müller

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikely and 10 being very likely, how would you rate the likelihood of reaching an agreement in the future? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: Why did you rate the likelihood of reaching an agreement in the future as 1 out of 10?
name: Evaluator

content: I rated the likelihood of reaching an agreement in the future as 1 out of 10 because the landlord made it clear that 580 Euro per month was the final offer. Since this amount was higher than my budget, and the landlord was unwilling to lower the price further, it is unlikely that we would reach an agreement in the future.
name: Max Müller

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator
